revised_title: Synaptic Distribution of Retinal Input in Guinea-Pig Superior Colliculus
tldr: The authors investigated the synaptic distribution of retinal input in the superficial layers of the guinea-pig superior colliculus using current source-density analysis. They discovered that four populations of optic nerve fibers project to the colliculus, with synaptic sites located at different depths in the superficial layers. These findings were compared with the distribution of retinocollicular terminals and the morphology of postsynaptic elements in the superficial layers.
